07799906943

bigben1977 wrote:
The bus will not de value


not so sure about that, its jumped by about 30% from when Colin was selling it about 18 months ago, so reckon that 30% could be at risk

Theres justification in the increase due to the amount I had to do to bring upto the kind of standard I wanted, fuel lines, brake lines, oil lines, oil stat, alternator, dropped spindles, all new shocks( the rear ones had snapped, been welded, then snapped again?) new rear brakes..the list goes on... Total spend well into the £1000's . Roughly 3/4 months ago 70% of which is for parts...

Yes there are cheaper options out there, I appreciate that, but there are cheaper options for all the buses for sale, just depends at what level you want to enter into..

If your wanting a bus that's had just about everything replaced to give complete peace of mind this bus would be a good contender now, no hidden suprises, everything as it should be, where it should be.

There is a lot to be said for peace of mind... I suppose not de valuing is a strong statement, it will be worth what ever the person has invested into it and believes it's worth as a result of the investment.

Appreciate your comment Maddison.

Regards
Ben
GLWS ..loved this panel when Col had it

Great Picture.. )
Looks great

It was spot on when i had it with no issues whatsoever, all shocks were new, in fact most things were new, so not sure when it all went wrong as you say ! must have been the bloke i sold it too.

It is top notch this panel and i do wish i had never sold it to be honest

Great pic mate I do love that pic

I suspect they were issues that were potentially ignored/not realised by the previous owner.. Anyway.. All that's in the past..

I do actually love the bus, gives me a great feeling when I'm driving in it.. And getting the reactions when I put the hammer down.. cleaning it and polishing it is a pleasure too..

If I decide to keep it I'm considering getting it tubbed, lowering it as far as practical adding 17" alloys, then finally a colour change to the exterior and then interior.... These changes will not increase the value, just my pleasure of owning it..hence my wobble and consideration to buying something that's already similar to the look I want to achieve... But then there isn't the feeling of creating something personal..

Option 2 is just fully commit and sod the costs and create something that looks superb (in my mind of course)

Help please??

bigben1977 wrote:
I suppose not de valuing is a strong statement, it will be worth what ever the person has invested into it and believes it's worth as a result of the investment.


That's not how it works, I have come across cars in the past that have had £70k spent on them during a restoration and are valued at £40k once finished.

This is a prime example, The seller is selling on behalf of his customer.
His customer may have invested his asking price in to this panel but its only worth a 1/3. v v v

viewtopic.php?f=51&t=109125

You paid a hefty bill for work carried out on this van and are obviously hoping to pass that cost on to the potential new owner.
Its not a great selling point to say it was money well spent and expecting the new owner to agree. Some folks would be thinking I could have saved myself £8.5k by doing the work myself.

Its a great looking van and Im not saying its not worth the asking price, Just saying how much you invest in something does not necessarily mean its value goes up.

Good luck with the sale, All that said in todays market its probably not a bad price


bigben1977 wrote:
Px would be considered..


I will take in PX against my panel v v v

viewtopic.php?f=51&t=108950

I agree totally with your comments, it's difficult balancing the bus value and emotion involved of selling it.. With the different selection out there, rat look, standard un molested, small engine, big engine..etc

I guess I've put it on at a price I feel it's worth to the right person with some negotiation. I do put a value on the work that has been carried out, and most definitely believe I have increased the value of the bus, I'm not however expecting to recoupe all the money spent, the bus is perfect in my eyes in every aspect, mechanically, body work is solid, floors are solid, big powerful engine, fabulous cab, full rock n roll bed neatly upholstered... Literally the van doesn't need anything doing.. Buy, run and enjoy... I do believe because of this it's really worth every penny..

I've looked at your panel a few times and it does look stunning, and I can appreciate what it is etc, but it needs to stay as it is, and I would want to make a few changes.. Which would essentially de value it I guess.

As for the work, it's difficult to judge as I have literally zero mechanical knowledge on these things, so you put your trust into company's that do.. And on occasion you pay the privilege to get a certain caliber of work. I'm over the moon with the works carried out and when you see the list, probably 70% is parts...

I get the feeling there are really experienced and knowledgable guys who have been around VW's for quite a few years,This is my first bus and I'm enjoying owning It, I'm probably going to end up keeping it, I just have an urge for a split single or double cab pick up for some reason...

Again, I appreciate your comments and feed back..

Regards
Ben
